Topic.Title: The Top

Message.Msg: 4 months is way too long. If you want to use the CMG analogy, look at the Feb earnings report. CMG sold off initially then started on the ramp. Before rolling over in May with the death blow in July. Amzn did the same last report. Head fake down then up. It started it's assent then and will top off next month. Get your puts ready! Going to be an interesting fall ( pun intended) - PJ

Message.Msg: ...wouldn't you say???

Message.Title: NTWK $6.2 Up 3%....Hottest NASDAQ stock up every day.....Just the start of a prolonged rally to double digits.....Fundamentals can support $16 per analysts......Technicals looking better each day......Cloud Division is growing exponentially.....only 6 PE and 1 times sales is 30% of sector average......Very cheap even with the recent gains when considering the recent steady growth and strong guidance of over 30% revenue growth and $1/share net income in 2013
Message.Msg: Easy Double Short Term (few weeks).......Must-see Chart In 2010 NTWK went from $8 to $24 in a few weeks. Today NTWK is a much stronger company with far more revenue sources including new Cloud Divisions. Unlike 2010, NTWK today has the flexibility to deliver reliable software products and services not only from Pakistan but also from excellence centers located in Bangkok, Beijing, the US, and the UK. The float today is 1/10 of what it was then and 2013 revenues are expected to breakaway into the mid $40 million for the first time in company history. During 2010 (and 2007) NTWK's market cap reached over $100 million on 50% lower revenues of what is projected for 2013. During the September 4Q CC NTWK officials stated that revenues are expected to reach $100 Million in 2015 up significantly from the $38 Million reported in 2012. They also expect margins to continue to go up as the high-margin Cloud divisions keep continuing exponentially to revenues. MUST READ ……This Week’s Analysts Comments on Upgrade: We project 13% annual growth to FY14 from FY10 reflecting 80 significant NFS legacy customers in FY14, up from 52, 37, and 28 in FY12, FY11, and FY10, respectively. The new Vroozi Cloud Division contributed $1.3 million in FY12. We expect at least $4 million in FY13 and $6 million to FY14 Our price target is based on the average forward 2013 P/E multiple of 13.2X (up from 12.8X in August 2012). NTWK is trading at 6.4X our FY13 projections. We are forecasting EPS of $0.85 per share. We applied an 11X multiple to our FY13 EPS forecast. We anticipate a richer multiple as earnings momentum builds in FY13. The company guidance calls for $1/share net income in 2013. NTWK is entering FY13 with a $25 million backlog and approximately $100 million in qualified leads. One quarter of the backlog is from four new NFS platform customer implementations that began in 4Q12. In August 2011, NetSol launched its Cloud Vroozi Division, an e-procurement search tool for SAP supplier relationship management (SRM) users. SAP AG is a global vendor of enterprise management systems that has the largest market share (24%) based on a worldwide Gartner survey. Vroozi should provide sales diversification and a higher margin recurring revenue stream. The Vroozi division contributed $1.3 million in FY12 sales and is expected to grow to $4 million in revenues in 2013 NTWK announced its 2nd Cloud Division last week offering an array of products and services to capture a greater % of the cloud applications in North America. The company is implementing this division using their significant software development capabilities and infrastructure. === MORE NTWWK HIGHLIGHTS: - Company projects Doubling/Tripling revenues and net income by 2015 - Significant Institutional investor ownership and growing - Insiders bought over 5% of the Outstanding shares the last 2 years and never sold a single share - Total share count is only 7.5 million shares. The float is only 3 million shares - Trading at forward PE of 5 - Strong balance sheet with $1.5/share cash - Has global agreement with Mercedes Benz - Already 7 countries with NTWK software for leasing and financing Mercedes Benz/Daimler including China, India, Japan, and others…and a few more coming in quarters/years ahead. - No.1 in China and APAC in leasing/financing software products and services. NTWK has over 50 Fortune 100 loyal customers. Never lost a customer. None of the customers is over 5% of the total revenues - partial customer list: CitiGroup, Mercedes Benz, Santander, BMW, Volvo, Ford, GE Capital, Cisco Capital, Paribas, GMAC, Volvo, Toyota, Nissan, Hyundai, BYD, SANY Corp. China, etc. About NTWK: NetSol Technologies, Inc. ((NASDAQ: NTWK) is a worldwide provider of global IT and enterprise application solutions that include credit and finance portfolio management systems, SAP consulting and services, custom development, systems integration, and technical services for the global Financial, Leasing, Insurance, Energy, and Technology markets. Headquartered in Calabasas, Calif., NetSol's product and services offerings have achieved ISO 9001, ISO 20000, ISO 27001, and SEI (Software Engineering Institute) CMMI (Capability Maturity Model) Maturity Level 5 assessments, a distinction shared by only 178 companies worldwide. The company's clients include Fortune 500 manufacturers, global automakers, financial institutions, utilities, technology providers, and government agencies. NetSol has delivery and support locations in San Francisco, London, Beijing, Bangkok, Lahore, Adelaide and Riyadh.

Topic.Title: The Top

Message.Msg: PJ: What will be interesting to see if the funds who saw themselves get crushed in CMGs and GMCR's falls learn from it and sell hard starting today. That it will end sometime in Q4 is virtually certain. Those that wait could find themselves with losses by EOY because others have learned and front rn the exit. I don't know how it will play out. I do know I will be here to see it happen. I wouldn't expect any moves down before EOQ though...

Message.Title: Tech - Its funny how these pumperz come crawling out of the woodwork for no other reason but to bash shorts
Message.Msg: the higher a super pump play goes and the closer it comes to obliteration, the harder they bash.... They themselves rarely have a spund arguement for holding a scam stok, sybil honestly believes that few if any have ever opened or currenty maintain a long position; that they simply show up to bash in the parabola of a scam momo play.... Sybs has experienced the same type of poster on every stok play sybil has won.... Nflx, fslr, cmg, pcln, for new age SUPER PUMPS.... Its like they are the same person, just a different uers handle..... This mentality works on the flipside too were you have shorts posting irrational posts on a stok that sybil has chosen to go long on... In the POST CRASH ERA of stox, sybil went long in the face of stupid bashing bears in bac, aa, csco, and sybs best one from the depths of 2009 and a quadruple hit - mbi..... Again sybs figures the majority actually didnt have a position, they simply were there to bash the oposition of over done momo to the downside. Very few recognize what sybil knows to be true - parabolic peaks and valleys represent little more than a setup for wealth to be transfered from the many to the few. The few use stox as a ligitimized mechanism for their robotic tools to transfer the wealth. stok credits are manipulated to favor of the few, and then reconstituted to bernanke bux as quickly and effeciently as possible.... You just have to think like a robot, not try to trade like one.... If you try to trade like a robot then you will lose everytime.... To think like a robot, you dont try to reason with momo idiots, just execute the script with maximum efficiencyvand ignore everything else.

Topic.Title: Sybs cant wait for this thing to crash just to shut the pumperz up

Message.Msg: Plunge protection is on. That's why it held up on yesterday's quick sell. Any move will be controlled. Much as every CNBC pundit would like everyoneto believe the market is strong, it is outrageously vulnerable. Privately, people now reallize that the equity redemptions are structural, that the boomers are not day traders and will continue pulling funds until it corrects and becomes investable again. But, they need to manage the S&P drop else it could get ugly (and I'm not talking about the Presidential race). Reality is that cash and ST bonds are the best place to put money right now. All the talking heads say bonds are expensive (but it is a stupid and completely false claims since no one but the Fed is buying 30YR except for MBS and that will prove to be stupid in time), but if yields/inflation go up, ST bonds will still only lose a little. High multiple stocks will get crushed...

Message.Title: EPS est declining but PE going up?
Message.Msg: Yahoo Finance shows that AMZN's EPS est has been declining over time for the next few quarters but PE is going up. Trailing PE of 318 and forward PE of 108 (when they will report losses for the current quarter) is extremely risky bet because the valuation is nothing but pure speculation. Sooner or later reality will set in.

Message.Title: Technical Analysis on AMZN
Message.Msg: Cup and handle breakout at 247 indicates more upside. Only 2% short. CMG was 20% short during it rise. Never the less, I plan to short AMZN @ 265, but only for a one day drop.

Topic.Title: EPS est declining but PE going up?

Message.Msg: Yup, makes no sense to me. If AMZN were in the start-up phase, I could understand the valuation. However, they are already about half the market cap of WMT. Operating margins would have to increase 5 fold to bring the p/e to a reasonable level.

Topic.Title: Shorts here are completely demoralized . . .

Message.Msg: Some of us go short sometimes and long sometimes. So where does that put the game? I frankly don't care whether you are long or short. It's only a question of your valuation and trading objectives and horizon. Longs have to buy and sell to make money. Shorts have to buy and sell to make money. But why the invective when someone else does something different.? In fact you wouldn't have a market if everyone thought the same. It's different judgements and calculations of value that produce the market. So you should welcome someone who has a different view. Lesson 101 in Markets and Capitalism. Read your Marx and Lenin.

Topic.Title: Short Simply Don't Get The Implications of the Walmart Move

Message.Msg: "Walmart knows a thing or two about moving product and since they are in all 50 states and 26 countries - this is not good news." Why not? It was good news 15 years ago when Walmart could do nothing to blunt Amazon huge success when it was a company of a fraction of the size it is today so 15 years later it should be 15 times as much the good news it was back then. Walmart will not be able to stop Amazon shorts from being steamrolled over and over. "Folks want to touch this thing and without Walmart and Target putting on their floors." No, they want to buy things conveniently without waiting hours for a parking spot and in check out lines. Only unemployed shorts have the luxury of standing all day in lines.

Message.Title: DUMP this PIG (with a profit) while you still can...
Message.Msg: ...WAAAY overpriced and negative news keeps coming. You've been forewarned Longs. At least do the smart thing and take 50% of your money off the table and lock in some profit. Contrary to what the delusional on this board are saying, AMZN stock price ain't gonna "go to the moon". No sir, not with a 300+ PE and every other fundamental measure of valuation srcreaming waaay, waaay overpriced. OPEN YOUR FKN EYES ALREADY!!!!

Topic.Title: Whats Going on AMZN? Some BIZZARE Volume..

Message.Msg: Thanks for the info Caution.

Topic.Title: More of Techstrategy's Double Talk

Message.Msg: "Amazon's business strategy to destroy the profit pools from hardware will anger Apple and it would be shocking to me if Apple doesn't hit back hard on many fronts." I don't see how this could be possible. If shorts are correct then nobody buys Kindle products because iPads have received such glowing reviews. How can Amazon then destroy Apple's profits if their own Kindle product sells in no significant numbers? Oh, unless shorts are wrong, of course, about the success level of Kindle. Anger? We saw their anger already. They got emotional and broke the law (collusion). I think they learned their lesson. They are helpless to do anything (legally) to prevent Amazon from doing anything they want. All Apple can do now is sit back and suck it up. "We've already seen that it is matching prices on eBooks (at least for some publishers and I expect all publishers eventually)." Really? When was the last time you bought an Apple eBook? People want to read their e-books across every platform they own, not just on one device which is the way many Apple e-products work. Besides, if Apple is so "angry" and has so much cash, then how come they don't just undercut Amazon's pricing? "There will absolutely be a price sensitive segment consumers who choose to purchase the Kindle. It expect it to sell north of 10MM tablets a year. But, it still won't generate any meaningful cash flow... " Huh? You just said Apple wants to cut off Amazon's cashflow. Now you're saying it is not meaningful? See what I mean by your double talk?

Vroozi should provide sales diversification and a higher margin recurring revenue stream. The Vroozi division contributed $1.3 million in FY12 sales and is expected to grow to $4 million in revenues in 2013 NTWK announced its 2nd Cloud Division last week offering an array of products and services to capture a greater % of the cloud applications in North America. The company is implementing this division using their significant software development capabilities and infrastructure. === MORE NTWWK HIGHLIGHTS: - Company projects Doubling/Tripling revenues and net income by 2015 - Significant Institutional investor ownership and growing - Insiders bought over 5% of the Outstanding shares the last 2 years and never sold a single share - Total share count is only 7.5 million shares. The float is only 3 million shares - Trading at forward PE of 5 - Strong balance sheet with $1.5/share cash - Has global agreement with Mercedes Benz - Already 7 countries with NTWK software for leasing and financing Mercedes Benz/Daimler including China, India, Japan, and others…and a few more coming in quarters/years ahead. - No.1 in China and APAC in leasing/financing software products and services. NTWK has over 50 Fortune 100 loyal customers. Never lost a customer. None of the customers is over 5% of the total revenues - partial customer list: CitiGroup, Mercedes Benz, Santander, BMW, Volvo, Ford, GE Capital, Cisco Capital, Paribas, GMAC, Volvo, Toyota, Nissan, Hyundai, BYD, SANY Corp. China, etc. About NTWK: NetSol Technologies, Inc. ((NASDAQ: NTWK) is a worldwide provider of global IT and enterprise application solutions that include credit and finance portfolio management systems, SAP consulting and services, custom development, systems integration, and technical services for the global Financial, Leasing, Insurance, Energy, and Technology markets. Headquartered in Calabasas, Calif., NetSol's product and services offerings have achieved ISO 9001, ISO 20000, ISO 27001, and SEI (Software Engineering Institute) CMMI (Capability Maturity Model) Maturity Level 5 assessments, a distinction shared by only 178 companies worldwide. The company's clients include Fortune 500 manufacturers, global automakers, financial institutions, utilities, technology providers, and government agencies. NetSol has delivery and support locations in San Francisco, London, Beijing, Bangkok, Lahore, Adelaide and Riyadh.target......Technicals looking better each day.... Just the start of a prolonged rally to double digits…...Cloud Division is growing exponentially.....Only 6 PE and 1 times sales is 30% of sector average......Very cheap based on steady growth and strong guidance of over 30% revenue growth and $1/share net income in 2013

Message.Title: Kindle Design Center to Expand to Double, No, Triple Current Size
Message.Msg: "A lease that size could hold more than 2,500 employees, according to the Oakland Tribune, which reported the move on Wednesday. Lab126 had just over 500 employees listed on the LinkedIn (LNKD.N) professional network in September 2011, when Amazon launched its first tablet, the 7-inch Kindle Fire. That has grown to 937 as of Sept 20, including 850 in the San Francisco Bay Area" But shorts told me nobody is buying Kindles. That Walmart won't sell them and that glowing reviews for iPads means you automatically award them a 110% super-monopoly. How can these developments mean anything but a horrible, horrible nightmare for any Kindle short who thought it was just going to go away after the current iteration?

Topic.Title: Kindle Design Center to Expand to Double, No, Triple Current Size

Message.Msg: This all because wall street did not punish it without making profit. If wall street sold off its share like they did for NFLX when they see Amazon cannot make money, Amazon will have to think differently. The good day is over now because Amazon core business, retail will get hurt badly after start collecting sales tax. It has no cost advantage than Walmart and many other retails. Its retail revenue will shrink. New Kindle Fire cannot compete with Google N7 in many aspects * It's lag when browsing internet and books. * It's heavier and bigger than Google N7. * No access to gmail account, and google player. * No Google Map and no offline GPS. * Even not include wall charge(only USB cable). * It keep pushing ADs which is annoying, pay $15 to disable the ADs.

Topic.Title: Kindle Design Center to Expand to Double, No, Triple Current Size

Message.Msg: "This all because wall street did not punish blah, blah..." Huh? Not punish? That would mean the stock would be flat. What the street did was applaud Amazon, increasing the share price by 20% and raising many of the price targets. You can tout Google all you like but I don't hear of them doubling or tripling the size of their N7 design center. gmail? Who cares, who needs it. If you want to get to your account so badly there's a browser to do that. Maps? Maps are generic, they're rolling out a map feature to take care of that. Why would you need a wall adapter if you already own another device, Amazon is just trying to save the consumer money instead of selling them a bunch of useless stuff like the Apple adapters I have and never use since the original one does just fine for my ipods, etc. The street punishes Google on the other hand with a low PE multiple. This is normal for a company with lots of cash but a high failure rate when it comes to doing anything outside of search.

Topic.Title: an education please

Message.Msg: Heck if I know. But here's my guess. AMZN dropped on news that Walmart was dropping the Amazon Kindle. No reason given. Truth is, most Amazon customers hate shopping at Walmart and Walmart probably didn't sell a lot of Kindles anyway. Amazon is clearly out to destroy Walmart, so why help them? As you can see, this won't affect Amazons sales or revenue. So most likely the stock will drop on Monday (trend continuation) and pop on Tuesday. What will happen on Wednesday is the real question. Technically the up trend hasn't been broken. AMZN could drop to 247 and still be in an uptrend. 247 is half way between 230 and 264. Another positive indicator is Stochastic RSI, which is screaming BUY. Another positive indicator is the short sales ratio is very low (2%). Another positive indicator is the general tone of this board is bearish. This is an institutional stock. Few retail customers own it. The only negative indication is that I'am bullish and I am wrong 80% of the time.
